Main_Event_Assessment_With_Annotation: Severe Tropical Storm Talas was a tropical cyclone that impacted Vietnam during mid July 2017.

Total_Summary_Death.Total_Death_Annotation: Throughout Vietnam, the storm killed 14 people and damaged around 2,700 houses.

Total_Death_Per_Country.Death_with_annotation: Throughout Vietnam, the storm killed 14 people and damaged around 2,700 houses.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Death.Death_with_annotation: According to the Central Steering Committee for Natural Disaster Prevention and Rescue, more than 2,700 homes were damaged in Nghe An Province.
In the Quảng Bình Province, fishing boats were washed ashore by waves as high as 5 m (16 ft); there, seven people were injured.

During July 17, flooded streets and disrupted train services stranded more than 4,000 passengers in the capital. Railway services from Hanoi to Vinh were canceled while trains from Hanoi to Saigon were delayed by five to seven hours.

In total, damage by Talas in China reached CNY 60 million (US$8.8 million).

Location_with_Annotation.Vietnam: Severe Tropical Storm Talas was a tropical cyclone that impacted Vietnam during mid July 2017.
Location_with_Annotation.South China: Areas affected: Vietnam, South China, Laos, Thailand, Myanmar
Location_with_Annotation.Laos: Areas affected: Vietnam, South China, Laos, Thailand, Myanmar
Location_with_Annotation.Thailand: Areas affected: Vietnam, South China, Laos, Thailand, Myanmar
Location_with_Annotation.Myanmar: Areas affected: Vietnam, South China, Laos, Thailand, Myanmar
Location_with_Annotation.Nghe An Province: According to the Central Steering Committee for Natural Disaster Prevention and Rescue, more than 2,700 homes were damaged in Nghe An Province.
Location_with_Annotation.Thanh H\u00f3a Province: Vietnam's National Center for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting recorded wind gusts up to 100 km/h (62 mph) with wind damage being reported in Nghe An, Thanh Hóa and Ha Tinh provinces.
Location_with_Annotation.Ha Tinh Province: Vietnam's National Center for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting recorded wind gusts up to 100 km/h (62 mph) with wind damage being reported in Nghe An, Thanh Hóa and Ha Tinh provinces.
Location_with_Annotation.Hanoi: During July 17, flooded streets and disrupted train services stranded more than 4,000 passengers in the capital. Railway services from Hanoi to Vinh were canceled while trains from Hanoi to Saigon were delayed by five to seven hours.
Location_with_Annotation.Qu\u1ea3ng B\u00ecnh Province: In the Quảng Bình Province, fishing boats were washed ashore by waves as high as 5 m (16 ft); there, seven people were injured.
Location_with_Annotation.Hainan Province: During July 22, China's National Observatory issued a "blue alert" to Hainan province and the Beibu Gulf.
Location_with_Annotation.Lingshui Li Autonomous County: Winds of 62–74 km/h (39–46 mph) were recorded over in some places, especially in areas around the Lingshui Li Autonomous County, as the storm neared the coast.
Location_with_Annotation.Guangdong Province: About 22,901 fishing boats were moved while 39,425 people working at sea farms evacuated to Guangdong province.

Total_Economic_Damage_Per_Country.Total_Economic_Damage_Assessment_with_an: Total damage in Vietnam reached 1.6 trillion₫ (US$70.4 million).
In total, damage by Talas in China reached CNY 60 million (US$8.8 million).

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Economic_D.Economic_Damage_Assessment_with_annotati: Damages in Nghe An were reported to reach up to 993 billion₫ (US$43.7 million).
Total economic losses in Hainan Province reached CNY 24 million (US$3.5 million).

Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Wind: The Vietnam's National Center for Hydro-Meteorological Forecasting recorded wind gusts up to 100 km/h (62 mph) with wind damage being reported in Nghe An, Thanh Hóa and Ha Tinh provinces.
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Rainfall: Over 400 mm (16 in) of rain fell in the central and northern parts of the country in the two days following up to landfall, while the capital, Hanoi, received 100 mm (3.9 in).
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Flood: During July 17, flooded streets and disrupted train services stranded more than 4,000 passengers in the capital.

During July 17, flooded streets and disrupted train services stranded more than 4,000 passengers in the capital.
